info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 2 at 7:45AM PDT until September 2 at 9:44AM PDT by NWS San Diego CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Bernardino.
* WHEN...Until 944 AM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 743 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen Onyx Peak. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area, including Big Bear Lake. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Big Bear City, Onyx Summit, Mount San Gorgonio, eastern Lucerne Valley, Big Bear Lake, Hwy 38 Between Onyx Summit And Sugarloaf, Baldwin Lake, Hwy 18 Between Baldwin Lake And Lucerne Valley, Hwy 38 Between Yucaipa And Onyx Summit and Seven Oaks. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 944 AM PDT THIS MORNING
